Again, certain things are excluded from possession ou this ground, viz. res extra commercium and the animus domini is inconceivable in relation to an object which cannot itscll be conceived as a single individual thing. Hence the question arises, how iar is it possible to acquire Possession oi a single part ol awhole? Where the single part is to be possessed alone, this is possible (1) where the part is in point ol lact a whole itself: e. ga plot ol land oi definite extent, which the previous possessor happens to have treated as part ol a largcr whole: and (2) where the division os ilie whole into parts is merely intellectual, provided the ideal part to be possessed is precisely conceived as a definite fraction oi that whole.
